main event: On July 3, 1953, an unidentified object was observed in Reno, Nevada, which was later determined to be the planet Venus.
interesting points: The object was initially described as a bright metallic object approximately 30 to 40 feet in diameter., Two witnesses observed the object, which appeared stationary at times and moved in a high oscillating manner., The object was observed for nearly two hours and did not resemble any conventional aircraft., Witnesses initially speculated it could be a weather balloon but noted it did not behave like one., Extensive reporting efforts to the Air Force were met with minimal interest at first despite prolonged visibility of the object.
sighted object: unidentified flying object (initially perceived as a metallic craft, later confirmed as Venus)
witness description: two civilians, including a professor of geology
